lyrics.text: First listen and then answer the question.
lyrics.translation: 首先听录音，然后回答问题。

lyrics.text: Why does Kazyas risk his life like this?
lyrics.translation: 为什么卡扎斯要这样冒着生命危险？

lyrics.text: Harun Kazyas, the Polish scientist, has spent his lifetime studying active volcanoes and
lyrics.translation: 哈伦·卡扎斯，这位波兰科学家，已经花费了他的一生来研究活火山并且

lyrics.text: deep caves in all parts of the world.
In 1948, he went to Lake Kivu in the Congo to observe a new volcano, which he later named
lyrics.translation: 在1948年，他前往刚果的基伍湖观察一座新火山，他后来将其命名为

lyrics.text: Kazyas was able to set up his camp very close to the volcano while it was erupting violently.
lyrics.translation: 卡扎斯能够在火山猛烈喷发时在火山附近建立营地。

lyrics.text: Though he managed to take a number of brilliant photographs, he could not stay near the volcano
lyrics.translation: 尽管他设法拍摄了一些精彩的照片，但他不能呆在火山附近

lyrics.text: He noticed that a river of liquid rock was coming towards him.
lyrics.translation: 他注意到一股岩浆正向他涌来。

lyrics.text: It threatened to surround him completely, but Kazyas managed to escape just in time.
lyrics.translation: 它威胁要完全包围他，但是卡兹亚斯及时逃脱了。

lyrics.text: He waited until the volcano became quiet and he was able to return two days later.
lyrics.translation: 他一直等到火山平静下来，两天后他才能够返回。

lyrics.text: This time, he managed to climb into the mouth of Kituro so that he could take photographs
lyrics.translation: 这一次，他设法爬进了基图罗的嘴里，以便拍照。

lyrics.text: Kazyas has often risked his life in this way.
lyrics.translation: Kazyas 经常以这种方式冒着生命危险。

lyrics.text: He has been able to tell us more about active volcanoes than any man alive.
lyrics.translation: 他向我们讲述了比任何活着的人都多的关于活火山的知识。
